hackathon-description-text: The idea for starting CopenHacks came in mid-2015 by a student at the Technical University of Denmark (DTU), after having noticed that the hackathons that occur do not have a focus on learning and fun, but are generally hosted by some company that want to explot students capabilities to solve some company problem using company software in exchange for an internship or smaller, less significant rewards.
hackathon-eligibility: Individuals (over 18 years in age); Teams (up to 4 participants); Must be student; Must do all work on the project during the event; Must demo, not present a slideshow.
hackathon-requirements: Build whatever you like, and keep whatever you build! Only code written during the event will count towards prizes. Prizes to be released at a later date!
hackathon-rules: Follow the MLH Code of Conduct,

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device
Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
Skyscanner Prize: Best use of the Skyscanner API
Microsoft: Best use of Microsoft Cognitive Services

hackathon-description-header: Starting a more progressive, inviting, supportive, and enriching 'hacker' culture in Denmark.
